name: flutter-pos-app-ui
description: Flutter Point Of Sale App UI
readme_summary: This repository provides a modern, responsive, and visually appealing UI for a Point of Sale (POS) application built with Flutter. It showcases features like product browsing, order management, and a clean order summary, ideal for restaurant systems.
key_features: Side navigation menu with animated selections
Product grid view with images and pricing
primary_use_case: To serve as a pre-built, customizable UI template for developers creating Point of Sale (POS) applications, particularly for restaurants, using Flutter.
cover_image_prompt: A bustling, stylized restaurant counter scene. On one side, a chef is efficiently assembling food items (burger, noodles, dessert) from categorized stations. On the other side, a friendly server is using a sleek, futuristic tablet displaying a clean order summary with itemized costs and a total. Digital particles representing orders flow from the chef to the server's tablet. Subtle UI elements from the 'flutter-pos-app-ui' are visible on the tablet screen. The overall mood is efficient and modern, with a warm, inviting color palette. Rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with clear outlines and soft lighting.

name: Mockoops
description: Create üíé beautiful animations from boring screen recordings within ‚è≥ seconds
readme_summary: Mockoops is a JavaScript-based tool that transforms boring screen recordings into beautiful, animated mockups in seconds. It leverages React and serverless functions for fast rendering, offering responsive video templates and efficient caching.
key_features: Superfast rendering powered by Serverless Functions
Multiple pre-built templates for various scenarios
primary_use_case: Creating animated marketing or tutorial videos from screen recordings using pre-designed templates.
cover_image_prompt: A digital artist sitting at a sleek workstation, holding a simple screen recording (represented by a plain video feed on a tablet) and magically transforming it into a dynamic, animated mockup with glowing lines and vibrant colors flowing onto a stylized presentation screen. The artist's tools are subtle UI elements and digital particles. In the background, a server rack hums with energy, hinting at the rendering power. The overall scene is clean, modern, and visually engaging, using a 3D isometric illustration style with a bright, optimistic color palette. The repository name 'Mockoops' is subtly integrated into a digital display on the workstation.

name: chat-downloader
description: A simple tool used to retrieve chat messages from livestreams, videos, clips and past broadcasts. No authentication needed!
readme_summary: Chat Downloader is a Python tool that retrieves chat messages from various online video platforms like YouTube and Twitch. It supports livestreams, videos, clips, and past broadcasts, and operates without requiring user authentication.
key_features: Retrieve chat messages from livestreams, videos, clips, and past broadcasts
Options for filtering messages, setting time ranges, and handling retries
primary_use_case: To download and archive chat messages from online video content for analysis, record-keeping, or other purposes.
cover_image_prompt: A digital diver exploring a vibrant underwater world filled with glowing chat bubbles. The diver, holding a 'Chat Downloader' net, is actively collecting these bubbles, which represent messages from various sources like YouTube and Twitch streams. Some bubbles are labeled with timestamps and user icons. In the background, a subtle holographic interface displays the collected messages being organized into a clean, structured database. The overall mood is one of discovery and data retrieval, with a clean, modern illustration style and a focus on the visual metaphor of capturing ephemeral digital conversations.

name: telegram-files
description: A self-hosted Telegram file downloader for continuous, stable, and unattended downloads.
readme_summary: Telegram Files is a self-hosted application designed for continuous, stable, and unattended downloading of files from Telegram channels and groups. It supports multiple Telegram accounts, allows pausing and resuming downloads, and offers features like instant previews and PWA support.
key_features: Seamless file downloads from Telegram channels and groups
Automatic file transfer to designated destinations
Instant preview of downloaded videos and images
Fully responsive design with PWA support
Fetch files from Telegram shared links
primary_use_case: Automated and continuous downloading of files from Telegram, managed through a self-hosted web interface.
cover_image_prompt: A stylized, modern digital library where books are represented by Telegram chat bubbles. A robotic librarian with a gentle glow is meticulously organizing these chat bubbles onto shelves, ensuring each one is correctly placed and labeled. Some chat bubbles are actively being downloaded, indicated by glowing download arrows. The overall mood is organized, efficient, and slightly futuristic, with subtle UI elements like progress bars and file icons integrated into the library's architecture. The scene should be rendered in a clean, 3D isometric illustration style with a calming blue and white color palette, emphasizing the seamless and automated nature of the file management.

name: subtrackr
readme_summary: SubTrackr is a self-hosted subscription management application built with Go and HTMX. It allows users to track their subscriptions, visualize spending habits, receive renewal reminders, and manage their finances effectively.
key_features: Email and Pushover Notifications for renewals
Multi-Currency Support with optional real-time conversion
primary_use_case: Self-hosted subscription tracking and financial management.
cover_image_prompt: A wise old librarian meticulously organizing a vast library of colorful, glowing books, each representing a different subscription. The librarian uses a magical quill to draw lines connecting books to a calendar on the wall, marking renewal dates. Small digital particles representing currency float around, and a subtle 'SubTrackr' logo is etched into the library's main desk. The scene is bathed in warm, inviting light, with a clean, organized composition. The style should be a whimsical 3D isometric illustration, emphasizing clarity and a touch of magic.

name: mirrow
readme_summary: Mirror is a macOS security tool written in Swift that detects and neutralizes suspicious overlay applications. It scans active windows, identifies potentially malicious apps based on characteristics like hidden layers or transparency, and allows for one-click termination.
key_features: Intelligent Detection of suspicious overlay applications
Automatic Filtering of legitimate macOS applications
Visual identification of apps with icons and bundle info
primary_use_case: Detecting and terminating malicious or suspicious overlay applications on macOS.
cover_image_prompt: A vigilant digital guardian, represented by a stylized magnifying glass with a shield emblem, is actively scanning a cityscape of floating application windows. Some windows are transparent or have hidden layers, emitting a subtle red glow, indicating threats. The guardian's lens highlights these suspicious windows, while legitimate, clear windows pass by unharmed. Small, glowing data streams flow from the detected threats towards a central 'neutralization' icon. The repository name 'Mirror' is subtly etched onto the guardian's shield. The scene is rendered in a clean, 3D isometric illustration style with a futuristic, secure aesthetic, emphasizing clarity and protection.
